intro: Hydriastele rheophytica, commonly known as the water fern, is a rare and specialized plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are adapted for water retention. This plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing along stream banks or in humid forests. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, relying on wind for spore dispersal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
